Summary Niels has a passion for technology and what can be achieved through innovation. Niels strives on challenges, and is an advocate for high quality solutions that not only meet but also exceed all customer expectations. 
 
Niels’ background comes from a variety of roles in various environments including Corporate, Banking, Insurance, and Government. In his current role as Infrastructure Architect – Virtualisation and Cloud for IBM, Niels architects Virtualisation and Cloud solutions for some of IBMs largest customers including a considerable percentage of his time spent working with a large customer in the banking sector and prior to that a global airline.  
 
Earlier on in his time with IBM, Niels performed the role of Technical Delivery Manager for IBM at Qantas where he lead technical teams to drive successful delivery of technical services to his customer. Prior to joining IBM Niels was a Technical Solutions Designer for ViFX NZ, where he specialised in all aspects of the life cycle of complex Virtualisation and Storage infrastructure solutions. This role spanned consulting, solution architecture and delivery driving technical solutions to meet customer business requirements whilst leveraging all applicable technologies. 
 
Prior to his time at ViFX was a role as Lead Systems Engineer for Suncorp Australia, where he lead the integration of a large New Zealand insurer’s server and storage infrastructure with Suncorp’s infrastructure during a merger. Previous to this role Niels was a Technical Specialist for Promina NZ where he completed many successful infrastructure projects. Prior to these recent roles, Niels spent years building his technical expertise across a number of technical delivery roles.

 Experience Infrastructure Architect - Virtualisation and Cloud IBM August 2014  – Present (1 year 1 month) Sydney Area, Australia As Infrastructure Architect - Virtualisation and Cloud – WIA for IBM Australia, Niels architects Infrastructure solutions for IBM’s Westpac Integrated Account. His area of specialization in the Infrastructure Architecture team is to architect and design Virtualisation and Cloud based solutions.  
 
Niels draws on his background across various infrastructure technologies to produce solutions that integrate well, meet all customer requirements, and exceed customer expectations wherever possible. Achievements during his time in this role thus far include various successful VMware Infrastructure based solutions, Unified Computing System based solutions, and a notable IBM Cloud Orchestrator solution.  
 
Outside of his role architecting and designing Virtualisation and Cloud based solutions, Niels has performed various demos and presentations for high profile audiences, and added value to the IBM account team by providing hands on technical assistance and leadership to project SMEs.  
 
At this stage in his career Niels intends to expand on his architecture experience and work towards gaining Architect certification. Outside of Architecture, whilst involved in Virtualisation and Cloud solutions, he plans to expand on his virtualisation and cloud knowledge and experience across new technologies and capabilities, whilst leverging his leadership and customer service skills to be a well rounded asset to any Virtualisation and Cloud centric business 
 Virtualisation Architect IBM July 2012  –  July 2014  (2 years 1 month) Sydney Area, Australia As Virtualisation Architect for IBM Australia, Niels architects Intel based Virtualisation solutions for some of IBMs largest customers, including a considerable percentage of his time spent working with a large customer in the banking sector and a global airline.  
 
Achievements during his time in this role thus far include various successful VMware Infrastructure based solutions, a large scale Citrix XenServer solution design as part of a large VDI solution, and a notable large scale VMware vSphere and UCS design to host a XenDesktop based VDI solution capable of catering for up to 35,000+ users. 
 
In this role Niels not only architects Intel based virtualisation solutions and produces detailed designs, but he also guides implementation teams through the successful implementation of those solutions. Niels also likes to keep in touch with the technology he designs solutions with, by getting hands on wherever possible, as well as supporting his colleagues during implementations. 
 Technical Delivery Manager IBM Global Services April 2011  –  July 2012  (1 year 4 months) Niels was a Technical Delivery Manager for IBM at Qantas. In this role he worked alongside the service delivery managers as the technical arm of the team, leveraging his technical architecture and subject matter expertise to provide leadership to the delivery and operations teams across all areas of customer infrastructure. 
 
His focus was leveraging his extensive technical background to provide direction and strategy to delivery teams when tackling the most complex of technical issues. Further to this Niels had a large focus on identifying shortfalls and inefficiencies of existing solutions and implementations where architectural improvement could be made through driving innovation and architectural strategy. 
 
Niels was a key member of the IBM Account team at Qantas leading IBM delivery teams to ensure techical delivery requirements were being met whilst always maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction. Niels not only worked with the operations teams, but spent a large amount of his time working with the Architecture team where he took his learnings from operations and leveraged that knowledge to architect solutions which improve solution capability and efficiency.  
 
Niels is a personable good communicator and naturally builds good relationships with both his collegues and customers. Niels has leveraged these skills to build good relationships, earn a high level of trust and become well respected within both IBM and Qantas. 
 Technical Delivery Manager Qantas Airways Ltd April 2011  –  July 2012  (1 year 4 months) Sydney Area, Australia Technical Solutions Designer ViFX July 2008  –  March 2011  (2 years 9 months) Experts in Virtualisation & Storage Technologies 
 
In this role Niels specialised in all aspects of the life cycle of complex Virtualisation and Storage infrastructure solutions, including consultation, design, implementation and support. His projects encompassed less complex straightforward implementations, through to more complex and innovative integration of virtualisation and storage technologies to deliver specific, customised outcomes and solutions. 
 
In this role Niels completed numerous successful projects for ViFX. These projects included virtualisation consultation, design and implementation of small through to large complex VMware 3.x, vSphere 4 and vSphere 4.1 solutions. 
 
Along with his skills and experience in virtualisation, Niels also successfully architected and delivered storage solutions for various SME through to Large New Zealand businesses along with the design and implementation of their storage area networks (SANs). Lead Systems Engineer Suncorp July 2006  –  July 2008  (2 years 1 month) Niels worked for Promina Group who later in his tenure merged with Suncorp Australia, for over two years. He held two roles in this time, from his initial role as Technical Specialist through to his Lead Systems Engineer role. 
 
During his time with Promina Niels’ initial role was as a member the Intel Server Team who delivered infrastructure solutions for the various insurers who hosted their entire server and storage infrastructure within the Promina datacentre. These solutions comprised of Wintel, VMware, Citrix Presentation Server, and EMC storage solutions. Later in his time with Promina Niels was heavily involved in the merger of the NZ infrastructure with Suncorp Australia and was appointed a Lead Systems Engineer role. Systems Engineer CodeBlue July 2004  –  July 2006  (2 years 1 month) Niels was a Senior Systems Engineer for CodeBlue. Niels’ role comprised a combination of field engineering and account management duties. In his role he was allocated a subset of CodeBlue customers who were predominantly SME’s, to consult with regarding various projects which he would then deliver and support. As his customers were mostly SME’s Niels delivered solutions which catered for all areas of his customers IT requirements. These solutions comprised Wintel solutions, Networking, Firewalls, Directory services, Mail server solutions, Databases, Backup solutions, migration projects from Novell to Microsoft Windows Server and Disaster Recovery solutions.
